channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Witkoff in Moscow for peace talks. And, the Voting Rights Act faces new threats
item.description: U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff is in Russia to discuss the war in Ukraine ahead of a deadline for peace. And, today marks the 60th anniversary of th...

item.title: Voice of America director says Trump officials are illegally ousting him
item.description: A judge is demanding answers about the international broadcaster's future from Trump official Kari Lake.

item.title: 60 years later, Voting Rights Act protections for minority voters face new threats
item.description: Sixty years after the Voting Rights Act became a landmark law against racial discrimination, legal challenges heading to the Supreme Court could curta...

item.title: Hiroshima survivors fear rising nuclear threat on the 80th anniversary of atomic bombing
item.description: With the number of survivors rapidly declining and their average age now exceeding 86, this year's anniversary is considered the last milestone event ...

item.title: With $1K in cash aid, he built a life-changing barbershop. Now cash aid is under fire
item.description: This man in Mozambique is one of many who've received a cash sum with no strings attached. The Trump administration has criticized and curtailed the p...

item.title: Hiroshima marks 80 years since U.S. atomic bombing
item.description: The United States dropped the world's first atomic bomb on Hiroshima, Japan, on Aug. 6, 1945, during World War II.

item.title: The Voting Rights Act is turning 60. Civil rights marchers recall a hard-won struggle
8/6: CBS Morning News
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell didn't implicate President Trump in DOJ interview about Epstein, source says; China reportedly limits supply of rare earth materials...

item.title: Kremlin says US-Russia talks were 'constructive' as ceasefire deadline looms
item.description: Despite President Trump's threat of sweeping sanctions, expectations for a ceasefire between Moscow and Kyiv are muted.

item.title: Nigeria seizes 1,600 birds in 'largest' wildlife-trafficking bust
item.description: Nigeria's customs agency says wildlife trafficking is "frequent" in the country.

item.title: Trump hits India with additional 25% tariff over Russian oil imports
item.description: Mr. Trump said he was imposing the additional 25% tariff because India continues to buy oil from Russia.

item.title: Hundreds more deaths are attributable to L.A. wildfires, new study finds
item.description: The Los Angeles wildfires took 30 lives at the beginning of this year, but a new study estimates there were hundreds more deaths that are attributable...

item.title: Putin, Trump envoy Witkoff meet ahead of Trump Ukraine war accord deadline
item.description: The Russian president and Trump emissary held talks in Moscow days before the White House deadline for Russia to reach a peace deal with Ukraine.

item.title: Ghanaian star Shatta Wale's luxury car surrendered over alleged link to US crime
item.description: Shatta Wale criticises the authorities the seizure of his car and says he is unaware of its link to crime.

item.title: Protections of the Voting Rights Act are under threat as the law marks its 60th anniversary
One dead and thousands evacuated as wildfire spreads in France
item.description: The wildfire is the largest in France this year and has burned some 12,000 hectares of land, an area larger than Paris.

item.title: Trump hits India with extra 25% tariff for buying Russian oil
item.description: This will bring the tariff rate on India to 50%, among the highest rates imposed by the US.

item.title: Trump to put additional 25% import taxes on India, bringing combined tariffs to 50%
item.description: Trump has signed an executive order to place an additional 25% tariff on India for its purchases of Russian oil.
